data.title: A Great Taco at a Better Price
data.text:
Stopped by here today for the first time.  Please note they are no longer on Main street, but rather on 5th Street a block north of Main street..  They have outdoor seating, plus a few tables inside.  Turns out it was Taco Tuesday and their Carnitas Tacos were $1 each.  So we got two each, along with an order of bean and cheese nachos.

The tacos are served on corn tortillas.  They were fill of carnitas meat and with cilantro and chopped onions.  They also brought by both a red and a green salsa.  A;; was really good.  Will definitely be back!

data.title: Great little place!
data.text: We love a tiny place with "home cookin'"!  My parents from Houston are real aficionados when it comes to Mexican food and they want to go here every time they visit.

data.title: First Time not the last time!
data.text: My son is a coach in Wakeland and he said he wanted to stop here for quite some time.  Well, we did prior to a game and bought burritos.  Glad we did!  But saw the menu and plan to visit soon - like within the next 3 days.  Smelled good and tasted good.

data.title: Great Food - California Style Mexican Food
data.text: Finally made it over to Mariana's Taco Shop. The food was great! Really fast service and friendly family service. The food reminded me of the taco stands in Los Angeles.  Can't wait to go back to try more of the menu.

data.title: Frisco's best kept secret
data.text: I love this place and my kids love it too.  It's a little hole in the wall place off Main Street but their tacos are awesome.  We also love their chalupas, beans, flautas, and pretty much everything on the menu.  Cheap eats and delicious!  It's what you would expect of a mexican taco shop.

data.title: Best legit Tacos around
data.text: We love this place! when you want some authentic street tacos this is the place, plus the horchata is great. Good People. they speak english and spanish.

data.title: Good Hole in the Wall Taqueria
data.text:
Very small but good Taqueria in Frisco.   There are maybe 6-8 tables, so it can get a little tight during the busy times.

They have an extensive menu written in chalk above the ordering counter AND to your right there is a wall of pictures of many menu items.   I always get either Tacos carne asada or pork.

This isn't some place that you want to take your family when they are all dressed up and ready for a 5 star meal...but if you want a good authentic taco or other, this is the place.

data.title: Hidden Gem in Frisco, Texas
data.text:
My wife and I always go to a Mexican restaurant on Tuesday nights.  We look for small places that are mom and pop.  By chance we stumbled on this little unpretentious gem tucked away in downtown Frisco.  Fair warning, if you are looking for a place that has crystal glasses and chandeliers - run away.  Mariana's is a small family run place that is functional.

We were greeted warmly by the owner.  She patiently explained our vegetarian options and made suggestions too.  While waiting we munched on yummy chips with hot sauce.  Excellent.  Our dinner took about 10 minutes and came piping hot to the table.  My veggie burrito was excellent - tasty and not the usual Tex Mex fare that most places serve.  All of us enjoyed the food and agreed this was certainly worth many return trips.

Friends, if you are looking for excellent Mexican food in a humble setting - this is highly recommended.

data.title: This isn't TexMex.
data.text: Finally a real mom and pop Mexican restaurant. I agree with others, that this place reminds me of Los Angeles mexican food... the real deal.  Carne Asada tacos to die for. At Christmas, tamales were fantastic. This is where the local Hispanics go to eat...that should tell you.

data.title: Where is the BACON!!!
data.text: Ok, I understand we are a few extra miles from the mexican border so I shouldn't have very high expectations when visiting a mexican restaurant north of Dallas. With that out of the way I read all the reviews on this site and unfortunately got my expectations up, people kept saying how tasty the food was and how authentic it was but I have to say the opposite, we stopped in and were poorly disappointed. From bacon and egg tacos to the baracoa tacos the food just didn't live up the the hype. In fact I had to ask where my bacon was when I bite into my taco. This one isn't as good as people make it sound, maybe some one will improve on this concept and actually provide us locals with something to satisfy that mexican food craving. This one is NOT on the recommended list.

data.title: Felt like i was back in Los Angeles!
data.text: Excellent street tacos! Sauces authentic. Flavourful ingredients at food truck prices.  We will be back !

data.title: Good, indepentent, authintic, Mexican food.
data.text: My favorite so far is the chicken quesadillas. The beef tacos are good too. They are soft shell corn tortillas with chopped beef and cilantro instead of lettuce. I didn't use to care for cilantro before but I'm enjoying it more now and part of that was because of these tacos. Sometimes they don't put enough on but you can get more at the fixing’s bar.

data.title: Great tacos
data.text: Love this place. Good mexican. Is small but quality. Have goos breakfast tacos. Brisket good. good chicken enchiladas
